revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-03 11:02:49.000000000', 'message': "Adjust networking for flat network to work

Although we aren't using the flat networking yet - the plan to integrate
virtual bmc will require the flat networking to work properly. In light
of the changes made to the tempest and nova roles to get this working,
this PR makes the same changes here.

Change-Id: I7b5446b28b5d721437ad7d3f7adfcfa63dcfcad9
"}, {'created': '2016-10-04 14:16:17.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Enable virtualBMC testing

This PR adds virtual hardware testing for Ironic, so that we can have a
more realistic test infrastructure.

This PR does the following (so far, this is a WIP):
* Fix the flat networking
* Add a vlan provisioning network for Ironic
* Remove unrequired nova roles from the inventory
* Add tempest - which will setup the flat network appropriately.

Change-Id: I7b5446b28b5d721437ad7d3f7adfcfa63dcfcad9
'}, {'created': '2016-10-04 14:18:56.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Enable virtualBMC testing

This PR adds virtual hardware testing for Ironic, so that we can have a
more realistic test infrastructure.

This PR does the following (so far, this is a WIP):
* Fix the flat networking
* Add a vlan provisioning network for Ironic
* Remove unrequired nova roles from the inventory
* Add tempest - which will setup the flat network appropriately.

TODO:
* Setup virtualBMC/pyghmi
* Create virsh net/pool/volume/instance
* Configure Ironic provision/cleanup networks
* TBD

This implementation will be based on the devstack implementation of
virtualBMC within the Ironic role itself. However we aim to utilize
linuxbridge as an intial step, potentially adding OVS after.

Change-Id: I7b5446b28b5d721437ad7d3f7adfcfa63dcfcad9

This PR adds virtual hardware testing for Ironic, so that we can have a

* Add a provisioning network for Ironic
* Add an IPMI network for Ironic

* Add tempest - which will setup the flat network appropriately.

* Setup the virsh net/pool/volume/instance

virtualBMC within the Ironic role itself. However we aim to utilize
linuxbridge as an intial step, potentially adding OVS after.

commit_message:
[WIP] Enable virtualBMC testing

This PR adds virtual hardware testing for Ironic, so that we can have a
more realistic test infrastructure.

This PR does the following (so far, this is a WIP):
* Fix the flat networking
* Add a provisioning network for Ironic
* Add an IPMI network for Ironic
* Remove unrequired nova roles from the inventory
* Add tempest - which will setup the flat network appropriately.
* Setup the required pip/apt packages
* Setup the virsh net/pool/volume/instance
* Add neutron network settings
* Add pxe_ipmitool driver
* Configure Ironic provisioning/cleanup networks
* Allow network name to be specified for cleaning/provisioning network
* Setup flavor
* Add images
* Enroll node
* Added required packages for libvirt/qemu to work

TODO:
* Fix console log
* Fix the whole thing

This implementation will be based on the devstack implementation of
virtualBMC within the Ironic role itself. However we aim to utilize
linuxbridge as an intial step, potentially adding OVS after.

Change-Id: I7b5446b28b5d721437ad7d3f7adfcfa63dcfcad9

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints and requirements

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Iff823437b09ca2905b52271acce63d849f62bc89

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-06-09 06:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

yeah we have to be careful with things that run *inside* the chroot like package-installs-v2, because they still need to work on things like centos7 where dib-python is v2

Although, we could at this point I think move all builds to at least python 3.5 (trusty even) and get rid of the whole dib-python split ... but that's a much larger change.

basically I think only element_dependencies here runs outside the chroot"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-09 10:54:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> yeah we have to be careful with things that run *inside* the chroot
 > like package-installs-v2, because they still need to work on things
 > like centos7 where dib-python is v2
 > 
 > Although, we could at this point I think move all builds to at
 > least python 3.5 (trusty even) and get rid of the whole dib-python
 > split ... but that's a much larger change.
 > 
 > basically I think only element_dependencies here runs outside the
 > chroot

ack thanks for the heads up"}]

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Idce1f2a4d88ccdf96d40b7adc6bbfcd575afbc15

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints and requirements

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Ia3b71f68ba1714b7b7254119c1b610b1390f7059

Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

commit_message:
Repair the support for building IPA images with DIB

1) install PyYAML with dependencies

   DIB does not play well with virtual environments created with
   the native Python venv module. Installing PyYAML globally helps
   it to go past the points where it breaks out of the venv.

2) Switch to Debian Buster since Stretch only has Python 3.5

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/734414/
Change-Id: Ie0e083a7379f88be2c5bdf416f0dbfd02a4c8731

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I1ee45007d9d4e477d7326e93dff62ca17b217789

commit_message:
image_convert: retry resource unavailable and make RLIMIT configurable

This change fixes two potential issues with qemu-img on a busy machine:
1) Retry infrequent "Resource temporarily unavailable"
2) Make address space limits configurable instead of hardcoding to 1Gi

Story: #2007644
Task: #39702
Change-Id: I82a94e68e1aa1f634c7f0877ccd674574d1c9bb0
(cherry picked from commit 555c4948dc271ab882525d030303b3eca83585dd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 12:11:17.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Use doc/requirements for doc requirements following PTI.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I1c0aeb590b1ce0f5ee43f9bcea51eeef1c98f057

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Use doc/requirements for doc requirements following PTI.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I1c0aeb590b1ce0f5ee43f9bcea51eeef1c98f057

commit_message:
Debuntu: add apt-transport-https

I don't see anywhere we bring this in, especially on a minimal build.
In 2020 it seems like a base dependency, put it alongside
software-properties-common that installs the other apt helper bits.

Change-Id: I5b079eac4912cb4a164e9aa6158ed106a28f576c

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I66e7ccc9329108de987a0b39ff46e5f3d74efa07

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Ibd72ce6104d42c348e2e1340cb8b4f4f5c724af4

commit_message:
Do not fail in a venv when activate_this.py is not found

The standard Python venv module does not have this script, so currently
DIB unconditionally fails. While a real fix will be provided in
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704478/ this change at least allows
users to try work around the problem.

Change-Id: I45b79d4d283f2b3ea909612e652672dcb6092488

[{'created': '2020-05-18 12:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove congress and tricircle project teams

Congress and Tricircle both did not have any PTL candidate at the
recent Victoria PTL election. Those being peripheral projects with
no other project depending on them, the TC decided to remove their
deliverables from the Victoria release.

Since they no longer produce a deliverable included in the OpenStack
release, the Congress and Tricircle teams are no longer official
OpenStack project teams.

The projects stay on the Opendev infrastructure and can continue to
be developed and maintained. Should a sustainable team form around
them, the TC will consider adding them back to the OpenStack release
and make them official again.

commit_message:
Remove congress project team

Congress did not have any PTL candidate at the recent Victoria PTL election,
the project being peripheral projects with no other project depending on them,
the TC decided to remove their deliverables from the Victoria release.

Since they no longer produce a deliverable included in the OpenStack
release, the Congress team is no longer official OpenStack project teams.

The project stays on the Opendev infrastructure and can continue to
be developed and maintained in x namespace if necessary.

Should a sustainable team form around them, the TC will consider adding them
back to the OpenStack release and make them official again.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/721742
Change-Id: If49d6fd0ad3413d0c478900108dd055dbaaaa8b3

commit_message:
Enable glance cache prefetcher interval

As new periodic job added in glance which will run as per
interval set using 'cache_prefetcher_interval' configuration
option and fetch images which are queued for caching in cache
directory.

Added GlanceImagePrefetcherInterval to configure
'cache_prefetcher_interval' configuration option
in glance-api.conf when glance cache is enabled.

Depends-on: I8ece28a9b0c6f104130d817490e9ea4c2b4e7808
Change-Id: I5294f7b9984ef0b59f505819e2ce95c41e69d3c8
(cherry picked from commit 13b06b52488e94ee3845c59c012144117dcf8140)

commit_message:

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I54a2fde199c151eee0ca81c0db840609088803ac

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I5651bc099e70a5345b44d87e76a607ff11f0d34a

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-30 13:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 09:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-06-02 16:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2020-06-09 09:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-30 13:52:07.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ic436b800e4474a0e45703231f8138ad97505335b
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ic436b800e4474a0e45703231f8138ad97505335b

rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6709d09657c61c1c37736c4162942f8c587ceae8

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I882ab18020ee8a15a3204e72d1bf68f4d5195b14

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I524d5c8b09b31dbc6781792d5dc91994f7ed4791
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I524d5c8b09b31dbc6781792d5dc91994f7ed4791

subject: Use unittest.mock instead of mock
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-09 08:53:29.000000000', 'message': 'Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Id3007be0973e7da345aa9b02c6abde25a373180f
'}]
commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Id3007be0973e7da345aa9b02c6abde25a373180f

commit_message:
Fix os-keypairs pagination links

The API URL is '/os-keypairs', not '/keypairs'. Attempting to use these
pagination links as-is will result in a HTTP 404 (Not Found).

Change-Id: Ic04568caecc138e6016418f6878d031c4a0d3fb4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1866373
(cherry picked from commit f31efe0a0e3f194ca415ac41c225f63dbb69267b)
(cherry picked from commit 93f903d7949194a3e00647d8a17b2d3bee3904e5)

commit_message:
[Ussuri only] Fix for CentOS8 containers build

Tripleo centos-8 ussuri container bulid job is failing in rdo ci [1]
because of disabling epel repos in openstack/kolla stable/ussuri [2].

Remove 'epel' and 'epel-modular' from repo disable list as
we remove epel-release via base_centos_yum_repo_packages_remove.

Note: This patch is only ussuri specific,
as kolla do not have epel related change in master.

Here is the testproject patch to test
this changes: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/27963/

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/zuul/builds?job_name=periodic-tripleo-centos-8-ussuri-containers-build-push&pipeline=openstack-periodic-latest-released
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731798/

Closes-Bug: #1882246
Change-Id: Icdea9086970576a9178b51399054e0f888808064

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I2728250b2646af93c65ac7f18dbf7600fe5a286c

commit_message:
resize: Send only nodes_to_remove and node_count

When resizing a NG we should strictly send the
desired node_count and the nodes_to_remove.
Otherwise the stack update operation may replace/rebuild
nodes or other resources.

This was the functionality with:
Id84e5d878b21c908021e631514c2c58b3fe8b8b0
But it was reverted with:
I725413e77f5a7bdb48131e8a10e5dc884b5e066a

Story: 2005266
task: 39860

Change-Id: Ib31b6801e0e2d954c31ac91e77ae9d3ef1afebd2
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

The repo is setup in project-config to use storyboard, so update the
config.

Change-Id: I1ba7f47312fea8de36c4c0c0ca6bf9c2220cbf42

commit_message:
Add daemonize library

The daemonize library is still used by molteniron.

It's in a good state, but not maintained since roughly 1 year.
It's Python 3 compatible, officially up to Python 3.5.
It's released under MIT License, so license compatible.
It's already packaged in the distros we target.



Change-Id: I0c339b4202299521468ef657a3a3de9a68b9cd09

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Icc4368708d2f1a11cb976789d8e06496b231302e

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia7f902cce276b8e9bbc62a6f75e123521e471289

commit_message:
Remove useless hieradata for octavia tls_proxy

Currently we use apache+wsgi to run Octavia and tls_proxy is no longer
used for internal TLS.
This patch removes remaining hieradata, which isn't loaded actually.

Change-Id: I6fc8adffe5239bf776188c06a55b5d3ce73a9945

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Iac98e1abac61757ff143e33f0094babe42cc2e60

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 and docs support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content,
  use sphinxcontrib.apidoc to build module index again (this
  seems to have been broken when switching to sphinx-build).
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE.
- Update tox.ini for python3 only support.

Change-Id: Id8738ecfb0f578d2a7953c63ffe10779f835bcaf

commit_message:
Fix gate job failures and py3 compatibility

- Fix incorrect type handling of secret payload in py3
  (it should be bytes instead of str by default)
- Fix py3 compatibility of test codes
- Update expiration date so that resources are created with valid
  expiration.

Change-Id: I4935f601f87e9c49499da1034a320eee2e655b4d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 12:35:38.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I49a5a5876b0b995df0c3ce55fd517fa81bd79fd2
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I99b320c5dafffddf0390058bc112fd87b537420b

[{'created': '2020-06-02 19:04:34.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343

Change-Id: I6d02b20797cf1a0208a24e740d1f9dc921434b82
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I6d02b20797cf1a0208a24e740d1f9dc921434b82

commit_message:
Remove obsolete 'http' backend from glance configuration

Glance has a read-only 'http' backend that is obsolete now that tripleo
supports glance multi-store (multiple backends). Glance's web-download
import method no longer relies on the 'http' backend, so tripleo should
no longer include 'http' in the list of enabled backends.

Change-Id: I64ee3a3c8f0dabdeab16968c39ea00b8879f5405
(cherry picked from commit a2a04ed48874ecc343c5b6c2ef6a2166f909004a)
(cherry picked from commit b1b435e95d35e81b187bdb07e05a7cc9fb10df73)

commit_message:
Update Ceph role's Get OSD stat to use new data structure

The variables for 'num_osds' and similar are now enclosed
in an additional map whose key is 'osdmap' so we need to
use that key when extracting them.

Change-Id: I40bed1fdc9cd39295a1b9f9aaed21d3814d7e2b5
Closes-Bug: #1882387
(cherry picked from commit aa330a8e99e7280c87ee8b1988b7951f6c5addb0)

commit_message:
Remove references to mox3 lib

Horizon has switched over to only using mock instead of mox3, and local
usage was deprecated for removal in stein. This drops all references to
mox3 to clean things up and prepare for mox3 removal from global
requirements.

Change-Id: I271678f8d5522c89741651326947aed0fb83892d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I8dca3772b3b5295b6216830289aa6e61d213d45c

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I7f0cc935291e5c0c4f905ad2aa0fb03e6192abb0

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
to be installed at run-time.

Change-Id: I602e3f3dd3f158799f910d73ac9c759efe15fcc0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-05 15:01:15.000000000', 'message': 'image: autogenerate docs

$namespace = openstack.image.v{1|2}

The subcommand documents for $namespace were hardcoded and thus prone to
drift over time. This commit removes the hardcoded content and uses the
autoprogram-cliff directive to generate them automatically from the
subcommand configuration classes.

Some reorganization happened here. The `image` subcommand name is shared
by image v1 and v2. Previously the hardcoded document had them combined
and interleaved. Attempting to preserve this with autoprogram-cliff
would have required significant additional infrastructure. However,
since most readers care completely about one and not at all about the
other, we instead split the v1 and v2 versions of these commands into
separate pages. In case links to the old pages exist in the wild, they
are preserved, but moved (with redirects) to a hidden directory, and
populated simply with links to the new version-specific generated
documents.

Change-Id: I24dc6dc10671c7f1267c27002542f61f8a3c18ae

commit_message:
image: autogenerate docs

$namespace = openstack.image.v{1|2}

The subcommand documents for $namespace were hardcoded and thus prone to
drift over time. This commit removes the hardcoded content and uses the
autoprogram-cliff directive to generate them automatically from the
subcommand configuration classes.

Some reorganization happened here. The `image` subcommand name is shared
by image v1 and v2. Previously the hardcoded document had them combined
and interleaved. Attempting to preserve this with autoprogram-cliff
would have required significant additional infrastructure. However,
since most readers care completely about one and not at all about the
other, we instead split the v1 and v2 versions of these commands into
separate pages. In case links to the old pages exist in the wild, they
are preserved, but moved (with redirects) to a hidden directory, and
populated simply with links to the new version-specific generated
documents.

Change-Id: I24dc6dc10671c7f1267c27002542f61f8a3c18ae

commit_message:
Add cliff to libs-from-git for devstack functional tips

We should also use cliff from git in the tips jobs so that we can
see whether changes there break things.

Change-Id: Ie3375eb7bafafef7fa8209aa6500d1254e29954e

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- move basepython into testenv
- use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE
- update pbr to current versions

Change-Id: Iae3f34e63d5a7d84bcc74716e490bd3b02bcab52

The subcommand documents for $namespace were hardcoded and thus prone to
drift over time. This commit removes the hardcoded content and uses the
autoprogram-cliff directive to generate them automatically from the

Special things:

- Some reorganization happened here. Certain subcommand names, such as
  `endpoint` and `project`, are shared by identify v2 and v3. Previously
  the hardcoded documents had them combined and interleaved. Attempting
  to preserve this with autoprogram-cliff would have required
  significant additional infrastructure. However, since most readers
  care completely about one and not at all about the other, we instead
  split the v2 and v3 versions of these commands into separate pages. In
  case links to the old pages exist in the wild, they are preserved, but
  moved (with redirects) to a hidden directory, and populated simply
  with links to the new version-specific generated documents.
- The `federation domain` and `federation project` subcommands were
  previously absent from the docs. They are added. These are such small
  commands and they seem related, so they're put into a single document.
- Some pages were already being generated but were listing operations
  individually instead of using wildcards (possibly because they were
  created before wildcarding was supported by cliff). These are changed
  to use wildcarding. (We want to do this wherever possible as it is
  more future-proof in the event that more operations are added to a
  subcommand later.)

Change-Id: I2030f9fe370038c5908b6eb6bed9692a73fe5067

  split the v2 and v3 versions of these commands into separate pages. In
  case links to the old pages exist in the wild, they are preserved, but
  moved (with redirects) to a hidden directory, and populated simply
  with links to the new version-specific generated documents.

- The `federation domain` and `federation project` subcommands were
  previously absent from the docs. They are added. These are such small
  commands and they seem related, so they're put into a single document.

- Some pages were already being generated but were listing operations
  individually instead of using wildcards (possibly because they were
  created before wildcarding was supported by cliff). These are changed
  to use wildcarding. (We want to do this wherever possible as it is
  more future-proof in the event that more operations are added to a
  subcommand later.)

- The `service provider` document was incorrectly titled `identity
  provider`. Fixed.

Change-Id: I2030f9fe370038c5908b6eb6bed9692a73fe5067

commit_message:
identity: autogenerate docs

$namespace = openstack.identity.v{2|3}

The subcommand documents for $namespace were hardcoded and thus prone to
drift over time. This commit removes the hardcoded content and uses the
autoprogram-cliff directive to generate them automatically from the
subcommand configuration classes.

Special things:

- Some reorganization happened here. Certain subcommand names, such as
  `endpoint` and `project`, are shared by identify v2 and v3. Previously
  the hardcoded documents had them combined and interleaved. Attempting
  to preserve this with autoprogram-cliff would have required
  significant additional infrastructure. However, since most readers
  care completely about one and not at all about the other, we instead
  split the v2 and v3 versions of these commands into separate pages. In
  case links to the old pages exist in the wild, they are preserved, but
  moved (with redirects) to a hidden directory, and populated simply
  with links to the new version-specific generated documents.

- The `federation domain` and `federation project` subcommands were
  previously absent from the docs. They are added. These are such small
  commands and they seem related, so they're put into a single document.

- Some pages were already being generated but were listing operations
  individually instead of using wildcards (possibly because they were
  created before wildcarding was supported by cliff). These are changed
  to use wildcarding. (We want to do this wherever possible as it is
  more future-proof in the event that more operations are added to a
  subcommand later.)

- The `service provider` document was incorrectly titled `identity
  provider`. Fixed.

Change-Id: I2030f9fe370038c5908b6eb6bed9692a73fe5067

commit_message:
Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Id476227552c3fa91eecadbc6c4370c354f56a40d

commit_message:
Remove url image definitions from OVB settings files

The image URL should be defined in release files.
Currently, the OVB settings are overwriting the 'human-
readable' URLs with hash-related ones and failing jobs
in the component pipeline.

Change-Id: I1a8eb6d4458177e6ff84923e60d2194ce1e24888

commit_message:
Fix for latest zeroconf version

The zeroconf library removed address in version 0.27.0 [1]
This patch should fix potential issues with that change.

Changes:
  ironic_lib/tests/test_mdns.py

[1] https://github.com/jstasiak/python-zeroconf/#changelog

Change-Id: I694ae5587ac8c3aae43d98902f56738773d31284
(cherry picked from commit 4c185438e6b07b647457068de45a73a42352f886)

subject: Make container list --all work
messages:
[{'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-05-15 06:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-05-15 06:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This, also, will have to be rebased for the PEP8.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-15 16:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-16 06:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-16 06:06:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

So this definitely takes a CLI option that *didn't* work and made it something that *does* work -- but I'm not real familiar with the API boundaries in python-openstackclient. Would it be worth carrying some complexity to avoid a breaking change in case there are API users out there specifying full_listing=True as a keyword-arg?"}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-05-16 14:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-05-16 14:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-05-16 14:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

>  Would it be worth
 > carrying some complexity to avoid a breaking change in case there
 > are API users out there specifying full_listing=True as a
 > keyword-arg?

I ignored the compatibility at first, because I didn't think anyoue
in their right mind would use python-openstackclient from their
application when they can use python-swiftclient. But perhaps it
was arrogant of me to think that. We can treat all_data and
full_listing as the same.

This activity came around because our customers script using
"openstack" as CLI.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-05-18 00:05:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-18 02:56:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Again, barring concerns about where the API boundaries of the project are, LGTM.

(OTOH, you'd think that someone who wanted an API instead of a CLI would use openstacksdk...)"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-18 18:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

One more thought: http://paste.openstack.org/show/793748/

IDK which is better -- Monty seemed on-board with changing the signature in IRC: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-sdks/%23openstack-sdks.2020-05-18.log.html#t2020-05-18T17:52:22'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-06-08 21:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Make container list --all work

The caller in openstackclient/object/v1/object.py passed a keyword
argument full_listing, but the eventual callee container_list()
expected all_data. So, --all did not work at all.

The issue passed undetected because --all did not have a test,
so we added a unit test.

In addition, exisiting tests were using a test set that did
not look like the real container listing, so we changed
LIST_CONTAINER_RESP to be realistic.

Change-Id: Id0604bcab25892e43c26cd6656b2b2eef5daa69b

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I4e9fac7738991526948dcf708b86207185115fa8

commit_message:
[devstack] Allow cephfs daemon port access

If the cephfs protocol is enabled, clients
need to access the ceph daemons.

We also don't need to enable access to NFS
ports when not using NFS.

Change-Id: I077d12785f94c940716f0e479d43dbb29ddc3c3c
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: openafs-rpm-package-build: remove files between downloads
messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-06-08 23:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-06-08 23:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nwill monitor promote job and cleanup any old packages'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-08 23:27:06.000000000', 'message': 'openafs-rpm-package-build: remove files between downloads

Ansible's "uri:" download looks at the file and sets the
last-modified-time header, basically assuming if the file with the
download name on disk is later than the upstream version it doesn't
need to download.  This isn't the case for these downloads, where we
want each one as they are separate clients.

Remove the downloaded file between extractions.

Change-Id: I671e9df072a6c59d29659a65829af18deb5e3c9a
'}]
commit_message:
openafs-rpm-package-build: remove files between downloads

Ansible's "uri:" download looks at the file and sets the
last-modified-time header, basically assuming if the file with the
download name on disk is later than the upstream version it doesn't
need to download.  This isn't the case for these downloads, where we
want each one as they are separate clients.

Remove the downloaded file between extractions.

Change-Id: I671e9df072a6c59d29659a65829af18deb5e3c9a

commit_message:
Add CephFS Native scenario tests

Since we support CephFS Native scenario tests,
we can now add those tests to CephFS Native job.

For now we should blacklist the following tests:
 - 'test_create_shrink_and_write'
 - 'test_create_extend_and_write'

Those tests are using kernel client and require
CephFS quotas support. We should blacklist those
tests since CephFS quotas is not supported yet.
Once https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676722 merge
we will un-blacklist them.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/731284

Change-Id: I00ed2e0262ae625886ac86734cc978968845fb7d

[{'created': '2020-05-31 18:40:03.000000000', 'message': 'CIFS extension failing because of volume in use

Unmouting of the volume from service instance sometimes fails because
Windows clients tends to check the availability of shares even if not
mounted and the volume is in use then.

Fix finds out processes via smbstatus and kill them before unmounting.

Closes-Bug: 1703581
Change-Id: I2cbf959d7cb849d3ead1655b1a0932fd428a9e9f
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2c9fbc75059ac724cd845317473b7df4a8dcdc35)
'}]
commit_message:
CIFS extension failing because of volume in use

Unmouting of the volume from service instance sometimes fails because
Windows clients tends to check the availability of shares even if not
mounted and the volume is in use then.

Fix finds out processes via smbstatus and kill them before unmounting.

Closes-Bug: 1703581
Change-Id: I2cbf959d7cb849d3ead1655b1a0932fd428a9e9f
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2c9fbc75059ac724cd845317473b7df4a8dcdc35)

commit_message:
Extend statistics reporting

In some cases it is desired to extend stat metrics with additional tags
based on the selected connection (i.e. "environment"). Statsd does not
support tags, so add this only to influxdb for now.
Fix establishing connection from parameters when passing influx_config.
When exception happens, we need to also generate metric to be able to
see errors (i.e. timeout happening from Ansible)

I know there are no tests for that area so far at all, this will come later.

Change-Id: Ie0862f04eb224345559f9092cd0a9d8ffa43bef3

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I6c494de21c4898c5e011790b1fd9e0d70a9a2680

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-19 06:40:44.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change-Id: I628af06b3702925bef790b3b3d1c47c2d7c7cbb0

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I628af06b3702925bef790b3b3d1c47c2d7c7cbb0

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I628af06b3702925bef790b3b3d1c47c2d7c7cbb0

commit_message:
Fix iptables rules comments

In case when value of port['device'] don't starts with "tap_",
in comments to the conntrack or stateless rules in the iptables there
should be full port['device'] written. It will make things easier to
debug for the operators e.g. when using iptables_hybrid driver.

Change-Id: I427321fbb87865931b2b28abf7687d37e8d01a53
Closes-bug: #1880691

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4f371ec10b03aeff2ee0af7dab60403359cf69b0

commit_message:
Update doc to reflect code

In Change Ic38e41b31155a7d3a4f1f5fc606421dd525c1025, a behaviour was
changed to default public_endpoint to http://127.0.0.1:5000, instead of
not setting it in keystone.conf. Update document to reflect the change.

Change-Id: Ife5ac322809efa137c9dc2cb5d0dde2d07e979f7
(cherry picked from commit 252e349aae45895dc717ab36fdd02a31874e914f)

openafs-rpm-package-build: publish to subdir

This should probably publish to an openafs/ subdir, as currently it
publishes to projects/openstack-zuul-jobs/centos<7,8> directly.

sometimes it is needed to use other than `openstack` CLI clients
or older versions of those in bootstrap/other scripts that do not

or older versions of those in bootstrap/other scripts that do not
understand the OS_INTERFACE env var, and instead use the
OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE var (and --os-endpoint-type CLI arg) for the same

commit_message:
Set OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE in keystone openrc vars

sometimes it is needed to use other than `openstack` CLI clients
or older versions of those in bootstrap/other scripts that do not
understand the OS_INTERFACE env var, and instead use the
OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE var (and --os-endpoint-type CLI arg) for the same
purpose.

Example is `neutron` command from python-neutronclient package.

Change-Id: I0fb7d1e9612391e8632d775b91848d3c834b9bd2

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Ib785406c2fafce25ac31217c2bafc4beb03fb82c

subject: Add an option to adjust help URL in horizon
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 19234, 'date': '2020-06-05 19:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-06-08 13:46:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 13:03:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add an option to adjust help URL in horizon

There is a help button in horizon dashboard that has various
use cases:

- by default it should point to upstream documentation;
- OpenStack vendor could adjust this URL, so it will point
  to his documentation;
- every cloud operator could adjust this URL, so users will
  be re-directed to some custom portal.

This patch adds an option to configure custom URL for Help
button using HorizonHelpURL parameter.

Change-Id: Ic95e55a007ea6db9336e81574c7a49185590eaee
Closes-Bug: #1879522
Related: rhbz#1835820
(cherry picked from commit d7624171067e959de593da33d05c88b8496160ca)
'}]
commit_message:
Add an option to adjust help URL in horizon

There is a help button in horizon dashboard that has various
use cases:

- by default it should point to upstream documentation;
- OpenStack vendor could adjust this URL, so it will point
  to his documentation;
- every cloud operator could adjust this URL, so users will
  be re-directed to some custom portal.

This patch adds an option to configure custom URL for Help
button using HorizonHelpURL parameter.

Change-Id: Ic95e55a007ea6db9336e81574c7a49185590eaee
Closes-Bug: #1879522
Related: rhbz#1835820
(cherry picked from commit d7624171067e959de593da33d05c88b8496160ca)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I5012b09da389bc0363b9cbbce48ccf26d5be5215

commit_message:
Remove shade from global requirements

This library isn't declared as a dependency by any openstack repos, and
the team believes all users should be updated to use openstacksdk by
now.

Change-Id: I21be66a6ec4e229e869037f139fa68acc079c05c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add ansible openstack collection

This requires at least ansible version 2.9. A new requirements file
is added to specify collections, and the env-prep script is modified
to install the openstack collection into the default collection
location.

Change-Id: I90b7ca4ea9491c3de197cbc4df83f7f959dd9571

commit_message:
Add ansible openstack collection

This requires at least ansible version 2.9. A new requirements file
is added to specify collections, and the bootstrap-ansible script is
modified to install the openstack collection alongside the OSA
ansible roles.

Change-Id: I553e9edf5d7e81e38438511a52e8cbee36589bdd

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints and requirements

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I3a9fd0888c70130198f8077092ee46016cf92bba

commit_message:
Restart rsyncd if the configuration file is changed

Previously the handler for restarting rsyncd was never called.
Split the config file template task out from the nginx task and
notify the rsyncd handler when the config file is changed.

Change-Id: I47982b5974c686a6dec7bd1a789daa54ea9652c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-01 13:54:34.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I8a1ab16a84cdbbaf7b22b5dc58aab54980866415
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I8a1ab16a84cdbbaf7b22b5dc58aab54980866415

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I27fd7e7310b2a1be3b283d43f40436ba5e165bbf

commit_message:
Remove remaining test pods before new test run

If the test pod still exists, then the new test run
fails with ERROR: pods "abc-test" already exists

So, Removing remaining test pods before new test run

Change-Id: I447d2b56b1419086b99df47b6605d0a95e1a9239
Closes-Bug: #1882030

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 00:33:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I8123f403a23f17c20cd5b114227fef45d2eb7992
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I8123f403a23f17c20cd5b114227fef45d2eb7992

Hello,

pep8 will be angry here too :)

I wondering why pep8 start to warn about the following now...

CI was happy few weeks ago on the same file https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716383/ and I don't seen changes there that could justify this behavior.

We need to keep eventlet's import first and I think this is why linter warn about the following imports...

I'm not fan to `noqa` all the imports we risk to hide useful info for the future, ignore E402 also is not a good things...

Thoughts?

```
./oslo_versionedobjects/test.py:26:1: E402 module level import not at top of file
import functools
^
./oslo_versionedobjects/test.py:27:1: E402 module level import not at top of file

^

^

^
./oslo_versionedobjects/test.py:33:1: E402 module level import not at top of file

^
./oslo_versionedobjects/test.py:34:1: E402 module level import not at top of file
from oslo_config import fixture as config_fixture
^
./oslo_versionedobjects/test.py:35:1: E402 module level import not at top of file

^
./oslo_versionedobjects/test.py:36:1: E402 module level import not at top of file

^
./oslo_versionedobjects/test.py:38:1: E402 module level import not at top of file
from oslo_versionedobjects.tests import obj_fixtures
```"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-15 11:18:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'll try a git bisect to find the culprit"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-15 11:40:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I bisected until da7cd17a2b0d46f42c2a03db7a2df8ee68b6594a and the issue is still there so I suppose a testing librabry have been updated few days ago and we don't cape her for latest version and this library surelly modified the way she checks imports and this issue is a side effect of this dependency update...

So I think we should take a look either hacking or flake8 or in this perimeter."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-03 09:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2020-06-04 00:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-08 15:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-08 18:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I2e87016e0dbabf0e5c2b6f05b8b3a2e0d026e20c

commit_message:
Fix reserved name variable

The scale down actions appear to fail under newer versions of ansible if
the nodes are unavailable. In the logs we see:

[WARNING]: Found variable using reserved name: ignore_unreachable

This change renames our variable to not collide with ignore_unreachable

Change-Id: Ida54f59fc1415122241493c02a0fc764d09ae6c1

commit_message:
Remove ValidateNtp

We already do this in the time configuration and it is no longer a
configurable item due to containers. Let's stop doing this in the all
nodes validation and let the time configuration handle the failure
messaging.

Change-Id: Ib0abcbd25117ecd587f4a92698746e5e256e6e8e

commit_message:
Make shade and os-client-config independent

These aren't really tied to releases and we're only keeping them
around for backwards compat reasons. Move them to independent so
that we can avoid release related churn on them.

Change-Id: I4c58625a3645a79d1bfe32064ee486fe6815b988

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-05-12 20:05:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks for pointing this out, Sean.

The patch that prompted this could get away with json.loads(), it's not using any fancy stuff from oslo.serialization jsonutils.  On the other hand, oslo.serialization was already present in lower-constraints.txt, which I believe was originally generated from a pip freeze, so something os-brick is using is already pulling it in as a dependency.  So I think it's OK for the rbd connector to use jsonutils instead of the standard library.

I'm just going to +2 without approving for a day or so to give others a chance to give input."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-06-08 13:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

commit_message:
Fix multiple issues

Both issues affect Train and earlier releases.

1. Fix monasca-grafana by pinning more Ruby gems

childprocess 3.0.0 and ffi 1.13.0 depend on Ruby 2.3.

2. Bump bifrost to 7.2.1

Bifrost had a fix to stop using the master branch of DIB which dropped
support for Python 2.

Change-Id: Ida7e20833360bbca69c6aafc4f5d7cb375bb106f
Closes-Bug: #1882070

subject: Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-26 20:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-05-28 09:40:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-08 15:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 20:10:12.000000000', 'message': "Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Id4d35c0a4bece51e4b51198123c875d302629e99
"}]
commit_message:
Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Id4d35c0a4bece51e4b51198123c875d302629e99

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 18:50:25.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Remove also now obsolete sections from setup.cfg and cleanup tox.ini.

Change-Id: I861983389f7dc57d229a2c87e28ff3deb91a4a63
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Remove also now obsolete sections from setup.cfg and cleanup tox.ini.

Change-Id: I861983389f7dc57d229a2c87e28ff3deb91a4a63

What was failing? we are maintaining netwroking-mlxn project and no-one contact us. Also we pushed all the tripleo patches to support infiniband already to be inbox in OSP. hey Kaifeng, this is just the name reference, the package is correctly installed based one the pkg-map for each operating system under dib/ironic-python-agent-ramdisk/pkg-map'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2020-06-04 12:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Then I think there might be some issue in the pkg-map, because after I changed the package name to python-devel，the log shows the package installed, haven't seen otherwise.
btw I am using centos7 as the base image, there is no python2-devel, the correct name should be python-devel.

Seems like we need to update here?

I just double-checked and I can see the package python-devel installed in centos7, although not as direct install but as a dependency, and you're right, there's no python2-devel.

subject: generator: Handle 'cfg.Opt'-type options
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-05-27 10:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-27 14:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2020-05-27 14:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-08 15:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-27 10:05:32.000000000', 'message': "generator: Handle 'cfg.Opt'-type options

These are used when declaring an option with a custom type. There's no
reason they shouldn't be handled and indeed they are albeit with an ugly
warning. Resolve this by making this handling explicit.

Change-Id: Ib7a6f26496cf19777b020c12998e953e9aae4601
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1880852
"}]
commit_message:
generator: Handle 'cfg.Opt'-type options

These are used when declaring an option with a custom type. There's no
reason they shouldn't be handled and indeed they are albeit with an ugly
warning. Resolve this by making this handling explicit.

Change-Id: Ib7a6f26496cf19777b020c12998e953e9aae4601
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1880852
