messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-26 20:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-05-28 09:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2020-05-31 13:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-08 15:49:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 20:13:32.000000000', 'message': "Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I68d8c3e3d5157a9ec385813eef37e9c7e17f9ae2
"}]
commit_message:
Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I68d8c3e3d5157a9ec385813eef37e9c7e17f9ae2

commit_message:
Add netboot to all partition jobs

We are changing the default boot in ironic to local,
to avoid breaking the CI let's set all the partition
jobs to netboot.

Change-Id: Id4573ff7163475cabb74f2931ed0b377bedbc8f0
(cherry picked from commit db6bef0c25f9742f376ef69a74c9a5fb50c399cc)

subject: Don't warn on lock removal if file doesn't exist
messages:
[{'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-10-18 14:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-10-18 16:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I prefer to only +1 for the moment, I want to take few minutes to speak about the possible impact of these changes.

They seems make sense to me if an user fully mastered its locks, this is optional and logs are by default turned to True so user need to explicitly chose to deactivate them, however if this feature is badly used I guess it can hide some log who can help to find useful info.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The purpose of this patch is to use this feature to remove leftover file locks in Cinder without confusing users (since we are trying to remove locks without being sure if they exist or not).

The WIP Cinder patch is https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689486/
And the email from the mail thread where this is mentioned is http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010226.html'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:58:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

So after some thinking about this duringthe  week end, I think that these changes are not a big deal and can help us to move forward quickly on the fasteners locks topic.

Seems good to me, I'll ask feedbacks during the next oslo meeting."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-17 16:56:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Any reason we have to do things this way rather than just filtering the log out using the standard logging configuration tooling oslo.log/Python provides? I assume there's a specific issue you're hitting that requires this? I'm -1 without that rationale, personally"}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-12-20 11:36:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Stephen: We are working to clean the file locks in Cinder [1], where we request the cleanup of all possible file locks, but many of them may not have been created, and we could list to check and then remove the file if exists, but it seems unnecessary.

With the current solution we end up with a lot of misleading log entries that may unnecessarily worry admins.

I believe your proposed solution of using the logging config is no good, as we would want all other pertinent logs on that same level, and in the future maybe even these log entries for some other use cases. 

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689486/'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-12-20 12:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-12-20 15:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> @Stephen: We are working to clean the file locks in Cinder [1],
 > where we request the cleanup of all possible file locks, but many
 > of them may not have been created, and we could list to check and
 > then remove the file if exists, but it seems unnecessary.
 > 
 > With the current solution we end up with a lot of misleading log
 > entries that may unnecessarily worry admins.
 > 
 > I believe your proposed solution of using the logging config is no
 > good, as we would want all other pertinent logs on that same level,
 > and in the future maybe even these log entries for some other use
 > cases.
 > 
 > [1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689486/

Okay, that makes sense. I wonder if it would make sense to simply downgrade the level of the log so? Is there a good reason to log at info, if you guys are okay with not even logging? I just really want to avoid special, one-off flags like this when there might be another way to achieve things.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-12-20 15:19:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> > @Stephen: We are working to clean the file locks in Cinder [1],
 > > where we request the cleanup of all possible file locks, but many
 > > of them may not have been created, and we could list to check and
 > > then remove the file if exists, but it seems unnecessary.
 > >
 > > With the current solution we end up with a lot of misleading log
 > > entries that may unnecessarily worry admins.
 > >
 > > I believe your proposed solution of using the logging config is
 > no
 > > good, as we would want all other pertinent logs on that same
 > level,
 > > and in the future maybe even these log entries for some other use
 > > cases.
 > >
 > > [1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689486/
 > 
 > Okay, that makes sense. I wonder if it would make sense to simply
 > downgrade the level of the log so? Is there a good reason to log at
 > info, if you guys are okay with not even logging? I just really
 > want to avoid special, one-off flags like this when there might be
 > another way to achieve things.

I ok with the current proposed solution (turn off this particular log if param is given).

Downgrading the log level (debug per example) will completely hide the log in normal situation (production env) and I think it risk more to blind us than disabling explicitally the log here when projects know what they need in this case (cf. the cinder case). Project like cinder seems to know what they need here and other projects that use locks will continue to log info if something is wrong. Anyway the result will be similar with downgrading log level here.
Maybe my thinking is wrong.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-02 15:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I -1 to highlight my previous comment and ask for feedback'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-09 17:13:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

A couple of thoughts on this: 1) I don't think we should log at info if the file just isn't there. The caller asked us to remove the file, and if the file is not there at the end of the call then the job's done. No need to log about it. 2) OSError could mean other things too though. Could we just drop the log if the error is ENOENT? I think that would address Cinder's use case while leaving the log in place in case something unexpected happened (like permissions don't allow us to remove it). That's arguably better anyway since if we completely disable logging with a parameter then if a legitimate error happens it will be silently ignored.

In fact I wonder if this should be upgraded to warning if we filter out non-fatal issues. If we actually failed to remove the file then that's something the operator probably needs to know. Maybe a separate discussion though, I don't think that needs hold up this change since info logging is the current behavior.

What do you think? Am I missing anything with my proposed solution?"}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-03-18 13:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I like the idea of only logging when the error is not a missing file and logging it as a warning.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-03-18 13:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-18 14:04:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I kind of like Stephen's suggestion of just downgrading the logging level. It seems like if a consumer of oslo.concurrency asks for a lock to be removed and that lock file doesn't exist, there may be an issue they want to be aware of. Then again, so the use case cited for Cinder, that also makes sense, so not a good clear answer to me. Dropping the log level at least could give a chance for someone to find out what's going on."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-18 17:29:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I kind of like Stephen's suggestion of just downgrading the logging
 > level. It seems like if a consumer of oslo.concurrency asks for a
 > lock to be removed and that lock file doesn't exist, there may be
 > an issue they want to be aware of. Then again, so the use case
 > cited for Cinder, that also makes sense, so not a good clear answer
 > to me. Dropping the log level at least could give a chance for
 > someone to find out what's going on.

So are you proposing that we keep the log message in the file not found case, but at a lower level? I'd be okay with that, but I would like to hear from Gorka about whether that will still cause them grief. It may result in extremely verbose log files in the gate."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-18 17:40:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

> So are you proposing that we keep the log message in the file not
 > found case, but at a lower level? I'd be okay with that, but I
 > would like to hear from Gorka about whether that will still cause
 > them grief. It may result in extremely verbose log files in the
 > gate.

Really not sure what the best route is. There are pros and cons with either approach I think.

Maybe this approach is best. It's unlikely that lock files will be deleted outside of normal processing without the administrator being the one to do so. So I guess the importance of making sure someone reading the OpenStack log output is aware of that is rather low.

Would like to hear Stephen's input on this, but I think I've convinced myself that this probably is the safe route to go."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-18 18:16:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > So are you proposing that we keep the log message in the file not
 > > found case, but at a lower level? I'd be okay with that, but I
 > > would like to hear from Gorka about whether that will still cause
 > > them grief. It may result in extremely verbose log files in the
 > > gate.

I was actually suggesting they lower the level for everyone, since I was under the impression the logs were mostly useless. Logging at warning for everything but the file not existing and using debug for that one case sounds even better though

 > Really not sure what the best route is. There are pros and cons
 > with either approach I think.
 > 
 > Maybe this approach is best. It's unlikely that lock files will be
 > deleted outside of normal processing without the administrator
 > being the one to do so. So I guess the importance of making sure
 > someone reading the OpenStack log output is aware of that is rather
 > low.
 > 
 > Would like to hear Stephen's input on this, but I think I've
 > convinced myself that this probably is the safe route to go.

I think a debug-level log would still be nice, just so have _something_ to work with. I'm not going to block on it though if we don't have a consensus on that approach"}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-06-05 09:41:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

From my point of view we don't want to log anything if the file doesn't exist, because the caller didn't want the system to have the file lock, it most likely didn't care whether we actually removed it or not.

As for why logging the message as warning and not debug in the other cases, it's because this helps any admin that may want to do manual cleanup of lock files, as grepping the logs will show which files can be safely removed, even if debug log levels weren't enabled."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:15:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> From my point of view we don't want to log anything if the file
 > doesn't exist, because the caller didn't want the system to have
 > the file lock, it most likely didn't care whether we actually
 > removed it or not.
 > 
 > As for why logging the message as warning and not debug in the
 > other cases, it's because this helps any admin that may want to do
 > manual cleanup of lock files, as grepping the logs will show which
 > files can be safely removed, even if debug log levels weren't
 > enabled.

Thanks Gorka, I think that makes sense. We can't fix the issue completely, but this way the operator at least has a way that they can script some possible cleanup outside of our services."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-06-08 15:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2019-10-18 14:35:16.000000000', 'message': "Support disabling logs on lock removal

This patch adds the do_log parameter to the remove_external_lock_file

Change-Id: I5ce8be34c9f2c4c59ea99dabc6760c3300f743a3
"}, {'created': '2019-12-20 12:39:02.000000000', 'message': "Support disabling logs on lock removal

There may be cases were library users want to request the removal of an
external lock that may not have been created and don't want to pollute
the logs when the file is not present.

We raise the log level from info to warning, but we don't log it if the
file didn't exist, since the end result the caller wanted is there.

Change-Id: I5ce8be34c9f2c4c59ea99dabc6760c3300f743a3
"}]
commit_message:
Don't warn on lock removal if file doesn't exist

There may be cases were library users want to request the removal of an
external lock that may not have been created and don't want to pollute
the logs when the file is not present.

We raise the log level from info to warning, but we don't log it if the
file didn't exist, since the end result the caller wanted is there.

Change-Id: I5ce8be34c9f2c4c59ea99dabc6760c3300f743a3

subject: Fix dependency cycle
messages: [{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-06-06 09:28:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-06-08 01:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-06-08 14:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-06 09:28:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix dependency cycle

There is a dependency cycle when using the nova::compute::libvirt
class and the nova::compute::rbd class in the same manifest.

The 'set-secret-value virsh' resource says before the
nova::config::end resource but up it's dependency path the
new libvirtd-tcp sources introduced in [1] depends requires
the nova::config::end anchor.

This removes the before nova::config::end on the set-secret-value
resources and only makes it depend on the get-or-set resource.

2020-06-05 08:26:58.966645 | centos-8 | (Anchor[nova::config::end] =>
Service[libvirtd-tcp] => Service[libvirt] => Exec[get-or-set virsh
secret] => Exec[set-secret-value virsh] =>
Anchor[nova::config::end])\nTry the '--graph' option and opening the
resulting '.dot' file in OmniGraffle or GraphViz

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730689/

Change-Id: Iab96968de75d7064b3aecf266d0f24b7b98dc809
(cherry picked from commit 345fac687a01075350fc057473dc042734024b04)
(cherry picked from commit e9931d92c90b94611e76c90bdf70bffb29fba68c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dependency cycle

There is a dependency cycle when using the nova::compute::libvirt
class and the nova::compute::rbd class in the same manifest.

The 'set-secret-value virsh' resource says before the
nova::config::end resource but up it's dependency path the
new libvirtd-tcp sources introduced in [1] depends requires
the nova::config::end anchor.

This removes the before nova::config::end on the set-secret-value
resources and only makes it depend on the get-or-set resource.

2020-06-05 08:26:58.966645 | centos-8 | (Anchor[nova::config::end] =>
Service[libvirtd-tcp] => Service[libvirt] => Exec[get-or-set virsh
secret] => Exec[set-secret-value virsh] =>
Anchor[nova::config::end])\nTry the '--graph' option and opening the
resulting '.dot' file in OmniGraffle or GraphViz

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730689/

Change-Id: Iab96968de75d7064b3aecf266d0f24b7b98dc809
(cherry picked from commit 345fac687a01075350fc057473dc042734024b04)
(cherry picked from commit e9931d92c90b94611e76c90bdf70bffb29fba68c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-04 13:12:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remove compat codes for CentOS<=6

commit_message:
Make throttle optional

Tasks did not have the concept of throttling prior to ansible 2.9 so if
we want to allow this to be re-used with older versions then we need to
skip the throttling code if task doesn't contain the throttle attribute.
This will help if we want to backport this for upgrades.

Change-Id: I01f6e3a69dec25ec69782c087d6b81ce3f33e6c0

[{'created': '2020-05-20 16:07:55.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I138d51ace230a434e76fbe9fbbe97e53212230f3

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change-Id: I138d51ace230a434e76fbe9fbbe97e53212230f3

commit_message:
Remove placeholders for shade and os-client-config

These deliverables are stable and only require occasional releases for
bugfixes. All future releases will just be done as independent
deliverables, so this removes their placeholder files from the victoria
series deliverables.

Change-Id: I4e5afdaeb5a6dc5116e56d78791c071a86e82a93
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-20 01:27:28.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Basic HTTP authentication middleware.

When the config option ``auth_strategy`` is set to ``basic`` then
non-public API calls require a valid HTTP Basic authentication header to be
set. The config option ``auth_basic_user_file`` defaults to
``/etc/ironic-inspector/htpasswd`` and points to a file which supports the
Apache htpasswd syntax[1]. This file is read for every request, so no
service restart is required when changes are made.

The only password digest supported is bcrypt, and the ``bcrypt``
python library is used for password checks since it supports ``$2y$``
prefixed bcrypt passwords as generated by the Apache htpasswd utility.

To try basic authentication, the following can be done:

* Set ``/etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf`` ``DEFAULT`` ``auth_strategy``
  to ``basic``
* Populate the htpasswd file with entries, for example:
  ``htpasswd -nbB myName myPassword >> /etc/ironic-inspector/htpasswd``
* Make basic authenticated HTTP requests, for example:
  ``curl --user myName:myPassword http://localhost:6385/v1/introspection``

[1] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/misc/password_encryptions.html

Change-Id: If50dfbfc18445ad9fe27e17cb0ee1b317ff25a0b

commit_message:
Enable Basic HTTP authentication middleware.

When the config option ``auth_strategy`` is set to ``http_basic`` then
non-public API calls require a valid HTTP Basic authentication header to be
set. The config option ``http_basic_auth_user_file`` defaults to
``/etc/ironic-inspector/htpasswd`` and points to a file which supports the
Apache htpasswd syntax[1]. This file is read for every request, so no
service restart is required when changes are made.

The only password digest supported is bcrypt, and the ``bcrypt``
python library is used for password checks since it supports ``$2y$``
prefixed bcrypt passwords as generated by the Apache htpasswd utility.

To try basic authentication, the following can be done:

* Set ``/etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf`` ``DEFAULT`` ``auth_strategy``
  to ``http_basic``
* Populate the htpasswd file with entries, for example:
  ``htpasswd -nbB myName myPassword >> /etc/ironic-inspector/htpasswd``
* Make basic authenticated HTTP requests, for example:
  ``curl --user myName:myPassword http://localhost:6385/v1/introspection``

[1] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/misc/password_encryptions.html

Change-Id: If50dfbfc18445ad9fe27e17cb0ee1b317ff25a0b
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/729070
Story: 2007656
Task: 39826

commit_message:
Reload files in policy_dirs on primary file change

It was determined that rules from policy files located in the directory
specified in the policy_dirs option (/etc/<config_dir>/policy.d by
default) are not re-applied after the rules from the primary policy file
is re-applied due to a change.

This change introduces additional behavior to make sure the rules from
policy_dirs are reapplied if there is a change to the primary policy
file.

Change-Id: I8a6f8e971d881365c41ea409966723319d5b239a
Closes-Bug: #1880959
Related-Bug: #1880847

commit_message:
Fix api.pp "Unknown variable"

When running, we get:
Unknown variable: '::placement::params::api_package_name'.
Indeed, the variable should be ::placement::params::package_name.

This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: I764ee3a47edc5b2d40ed1870bcb94ada3ed9ef38
(cherry picked from commit 142633cc5861694b7385f755024172b5d7ab032f)
(cherry picked from commit 7922ce0bcdb1c9a7f82f07ff7be85e0d5d07664f)

subject: Use never expiring alarm_url for resource attributes
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-06-05 18:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-06-05 18:48:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think this helps that much because the way people will generally use these is to fetch the URL once (e.g. for a scaling policy, it's used once to set up the alarm) and then expect it to work forever (alarm should never stop working or need to be updated). So I think for these cases we need to be able to pass a non_expiring flag to _get_ec2_signed_url() so that it generates a URL without a timestamp."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-06-06 03:20:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> So I think for these cases we need to be able to pass a non_expiring flag to _get_ec2_signed_url() so that it generates a URL without a timestamp.

As we discussed earlier, that won't solve the problem of existing stacks with these resources  unless they update the stack (to update the alarm resources) and get non-cached new urls with no timestamp. External alarming tools also have to change. But that would probably be an one-time thing.

I was thinking if we could just drop the timestamp from the request and regenerate the signature before sending it to keystone in ec2token.py which would solve all backward incompatibility issues.

But that would involve backhand calls to get the secret_key and probably require loading the resource(?)"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-06-06 08:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-06-08 12:01:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-06-08 14:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 18:12:03.000000000', 'message': "WIP Don't cache resource attributes using ec2_signed_url

As the ec2token now does not have validity beyond 15mins, let's not
cache these attributes that use it, and we get a new url everytime
from attributes and stack outputs.

If these urls are used statically outside of the stack (for ex for
scaling),they need to change to reference the stack ouput from time
to time.

Change-Id: If2ebc3deacb770294004ae023500367af603b59e
Related-Bug: #1872737
"}, {'created': '2020-06-06 08:33:23.000000000', 'message': "Use never expiring alarm_url for resource attributes

Don't use timestamp when generating ec2 signed url for alarm url
attributes of resource.

This will resolve the issue for new resources even if they are cached
in attributes or resource_data.

However, for existing stacks containing these resources the current
best option is to not cache these attributes and allow alarm resources
to be able to get a new never expiring urls in the next forced update.

Change-Id: If2ebc3deacb770294004ae023500367af603b59e
Task: 39985
Related-Bug: #1872737
"}]
commit_message:
Use never expiring alarm_url for resource attributes

Don't use timestamp when generating ec2 signed url for alarm url
attributes of resource.

This will resolve the issue for new resources even if they are cached
in attributes or resource_data.

However, for existing stacks containing these resources the current
best option is to not cache these attributes and allow alarm resources
to be able to get a new never expiring urls in the next forced update.

Change-Id: If2ebc3deacb770294004ae023500367af603b59e
Task: 39985
Related-Bug: #1872737

subject: Do not set lo.disable_ipv6=0 by default
messages: [{'account_id': 30126, 'date': '2020-06-05 06:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30126, 'date': '2020-06-08 06:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncheck-rdo'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-06-08 13:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 06:35:36.000000000', 'message': "Do not set lo.disable_ipv6=0 by default

Forcing lo.disable_ipv6=0 in tripleo-ansible may result in such
value being placed in /etc/sysctl.d/99-tripleo.conf *before*
net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 = 1, thus effectively being ignored.

See rhbz#1841522 for an example of a side effect of this, where
'KernelDisableIPv6: 1' results in epmd/rabbitmq being unable to start.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733521

Change-Id: Iea01c7d6ef19ed2f0a2b7ecab15de0c30fcb4f8c
(cherry picked from commit f7fe7a3e290ef7d63886ca8c8b63ff9c693bf307)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not set lo.disable_ipv6=0 by default

Forcing lo.disable_ipv6=0 in tripleo-ansible may result in such
value being placed in /etc/sysctl.d/99-tripleo.conf *before*
net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 = 1, thus effectively being ignored.

See rhbz#1841522 for an example of a side effect of this, where
'KernelDisableIPv6: 1' results in epmd/rabbitmq being unable to start.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733521

Change-Id: Iea01c7d6ef19ed2f0a2b7ecab15de0c30fcb4f8c
(cherry picked from commit f7fe7a3e290ef7d63886ca8c8b63ff9c693bf307)

messages: [{'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-05-11 18:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-05-11 18:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2020-06-08 15:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-11 18:09:00.000000000', 'message': "OpenDev Migration Patch

This commit was bulk generated and pushed by the OpenDev sysadmins
as a part of the Git hosting and code review systems migration
detailed in these mailing list posts:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003603.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004920.html

Attempts have been made to correct repository namespaces and
hostnames based on simple pattern matching, but it's possible some
were updated incorrectly or missed entirely. Please reach out to us
via the contact information listed at https://opendev.org/ with any
questions you may have.

Change-Id: I313fe752c179a367ef22227d7c0037c2c27056d8
"}, {'created': '2019-05-11 18:13:21.000000000', 'message': 'Rename review.openstack.org to review.opendev.org

There are many references to review.openstack.org, and while the
redirect should work, we can also go ahead and fix them.
Change-Id: I313fe752c179a367ef22227d7c0037c2c27056d8
'}]

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-23 16:07:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-05-26 14:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-29 09:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-06-08 12:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-06-08 15:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-23 16:07:32.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iec8ad8f132aa68ef8778b6a94266897956f74bd8

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If0c55ab26e2d14ce3bfcf78644502c5633a0bb65

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Idfea423764768d5a35c8b5b8f73286cd4a19a974

commit_message:
Update doc to reflect code

In Change Ic38e41b31155a7d3a4f1f5fc606421dd525c1025, a behaviour was
changed to default public_endpoint to http://127.0.0.1:5000, instead of
not setting it in keystone.conf. Update document to reflect the change.

Change-Id: Ife5ac322809efa137c9dc2cb5d0dde2d07e979f7
(cherry picked from commit 252e349aae45895dc717ab36fdd02a31874e914f)

subject: Replace external mock with built-in unittest.mock
messages:
[{'account_id': 32057, 'date': '2020-06-05 05:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-06-05 05:51:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-05 09:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Replace external mock with built-in unittest.mock

Now that stevedore does not support Python 2 anymore, there is no need
to ever use the external 'mock' package.  Python 3.3+ has it integrated
as 'unittest.mock', so just use that.

Change-Id: I28a50cac12670bb6987b4c7794a15e15aa1fe965
Signed-off-by: Michał Górny <mgorny@gentoo.org>

subject: Use Elastic service status in Metricbeat setup
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-08 14:29:58.000000000', 'message': 'Use Elastic service status in Metricbeat setup

The current Metricbeat template configuration will monitor Elastic
services (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash) based only on whether
they are expected from the inventory setup. This commit changes this
to use the service_facts module, so that Metricbeat will monitor these
services wherever they are running.

Change-Id: Iff8124ff4c162589cdd7077a3f8da3ba5743ca58
'}]
commit_message:
Use Elastic service status in Metricbeat setup

The current Metricbeat template configuration will monitor Elastic
services (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash) based only on whether
they are expected from the inventory setup. This commit changes this
to use the service_facts module, so that Metricbeat will monitor these
services wherever they are running.

Change-Id: Iff8124ff4c162589cdd7077a3f8da3ba5743ca58

commit_message:
Add netboot to all partition jobs

We are changing the default boot in ironic to local,
to avoid breaking the CI let's set all the partition
jobs to netboot.

commit_message:
Add scenario test for IPv6 VIP and IPv6-only members

This test tests traffic for IPv6 load balancers and IPv6-only members. This
allows provider drivers that do not support mixed IP version to test IPv6-only.

Change-Id: Idf76680ee16b42677a0fb474eb680cdf4826eb25

* Allow parallel building of documents

the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
rbd: Correct local_attach disconnect test and showmapped arguments

Id507109df80391699074773f4787f74507c4b882 introduced the showmapped
command when attempting to disconnect locally attached rbd volumes.
Unfortunately at the time the test changes incorrectly attempted to
assert the commands made by using has_calls instead of the valid
assert_has_calls method.

This change now corrects this, ensures _get_rbd_args is called to
populate all of the required arguments for the showmapped command and
finally corrects the name stored within the fake showmapped output in
the test.

Change-Id: I7e761828b3799cef720e15ca7896e8e8d6f98182
(cherry picked from commit 71331b0e06a713a0883f0c1199923e0943adcf09)

commit_message:
Wait for systemd-tmpfiles-setup service to complete after container restart 

There is a race condition between starting an lxc container and executing
the first ansible task. Ansible makes heavy use of /tmp and the first
task executed after 'lxc-start' will collide with systemd-tmpfiles-setup
which by default removes all content from /tmp, including the working
files of any ansible task which happens to be running. This causes a fatal
error for ansible which cannot be recovered with retries.

This patch adds a raw command to check the state of the tmpfiles-setup
service and wait until it has completed, avoiding the race confdition.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitriy Rabotyagov <noonedeadpunk@ya.ru>
Change-Id: I8111ae7548cddd71b0f384157e28ced40392401b

[{'created': '2020-06-04 20:17:28.000000000', 'message': "[TRAIN-AND-OLDER] Improve timeout error handling

For many releases we have seen overall deployment and workflow exections
that timeout throw a json decode error. This is usually because either
the mistral execution completely failed (unhandled exception),
something during the deployment hangs (bad network config), or the
--timeout was less than the time it takes to run an action. If we get an
exception waiting for timeouts that isn't already a websocket timeout or
something to that effect, we should catch it and print some useful
messaging that the user can use to begin their troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ie239f3fc11bbf95dc9af9786b288f6e8aef1193a
Closes-Bug: #1882134
"}, {'created': '2020-06-04 21:28:11.000000000', 'message': "[TRAIN-AND-OLDER] Improve timeout error handling

something to that effect, we should catch it and print some useful

Closes-Bug: #1882134

commit_message:
[TRAIN-AND-OLDER] Improve timeout error handling

For many releases we have seen overall deployment and workflow exections
that timeout throw a json decode error. This is usually because either
the mistral execution completely failed (unhandled exception),
something during the deployment hangs (bad network config), or the
--timeout was less than the time it takes to run an action. If we get an
exception waiting for timeouts that isn't already a websocket timeout or
something to that effect, we should catch it and print some useful
messaging that the user can use to begin their troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ie239f3fc11bbf95dc9af9786b288f6e8aef1193a
Closes-Bug: #1882134

commit_message:
Moving task type constants into Mistral task specifications module

* There were references to Mistral specific constants mistakenly
  placed into mistral-lib. This patch adds these constants into
  the module where task language specifications are declared and
  changes the corresponding references.

Change-Id: I8c7c6896f01894ac76cf9365abfdce17e7df7662

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 14:23:22.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4e3fe772adffbd70d55ce1b73d9161a6de5b9c11
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4e3fe772adffbd70d55ce1b73d9161a6de5b9c11

[{'created': '2020-02-23 20:03:08.000000000', 'message': 'All Neutron ML2 drivers use Allocation/Endpoints OVO

Now all Neutron ML2 drivers use OVO as input parameters to define the
allocation and the endpoints.

Reference of objects, inheritance, modifications made and presence in
other projects:
ML2TypeDriver (neutron-lib)
-> BaseTypeDriver
   -> FlatTypeDriver
   -> SegmentTypeDriver [1]
      -> VlanTypeDriver
      -> _TunnelTypeDriverBase
         -> TunnelTypeDriver [2]
         -> ML2TunnelTypeDriver
            -> EndpointTunnelTypeDriver [3]
               -> GeneveTypeDriver
               -> GreTypeDriver
               -> VxlanTypeDriver

[1] networking-avaya project inherits from SegmentTypeDriver, passing
    the DB object instead of the OVO. This project was retired.
[2] TunnelTypeDriver class is not used anymore. networking-cisco
    project imports this class if the version <= Ocata.
[3] networking-fujitsu project inherits from EndpointTunnelTypeDriver,
    passing the DB object instead of the OVO. This project was retired.

Change-Id: If23d52e7839edf065619c327dc0cf47b5b560bfb
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
All Neutron ML2 drivers use Allocation/Endpoints OVO

Now all Neutron ML2 drivers use OVO as input parameters to define the
allocation and the endpoints.

Reference of objects, inheritance, modifications made and presence in
other projects:
ML2TypeDriver (neutron-lib)
-> BaseTypeDriver
   -> FlatTypeDriver
   -> SegmentTypeDriver [1]
      -> VlanTypeDriver
      -> _TunnelTypeDriverBase
         -> TunnelTypeDriver [2]
         -> ML2TunnelTypeDriver
            -> EndpointTunnelTypeDriver [3]
               -> GeneveTypeDriver
               -> GreTypeDriver
               -> VxlanTypeDriver

[1] networking-avaya project inherits from SegmentTypeDriver, passing
    the DB object instead of the OVO. This project was retired.
[2] TunnelTypeDriver class is not used anymore. networking-cisco
    project imports this class if the version <= Ocata.
[3] networking-fujitsu project inherits from EndpointTunnelTypeDriver,
    passing the DB object instead of the OVO. This project was retired.

Change-Id: If23d52e7839edf065619c327dc0cf47b5b560bfb
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
[Nova] Add reference to Placement installation guide

Placement service has to be installed and configured with user and
endpoints before Nova installation. But in
stein release it is not mentioned in the prerequisites of Nova. Added
reference to Placement installation guide in the prerequisites section
of nova installation guide.

Change-Id: I6af43a24dc5b3575016f092268d98cc720249d93
Closes-Bug: #1829032

commit_message:
Make optional name and admin password

Nova API doesn't require name and admin password as mandatory
arguments for rebuilding server. Make them optional for SDK too.

Change-Id: I002101b21827005a7945fcc3669ccca1481204a5

commit_message:
Revert "Add indexed column support to ovsdbapp"

This reverts commit db0cdd9a4ffd64d99a6b012b5d0bf2c5bd4f96f4.

The commit being reverted seemingly caused external bridges
to be lost in the new data structures.

Closes-Bug: #1881424
Change-Id: I217d06b3ee2a04e7ab4995aef0696b791c228c6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-06 09:26:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix dependency cycle

There is a dependency cycle when using the nova::compute::libvirt
class and the nova::compute::rbd class in the same manifest.

The 'set-secret-value virsh' resource says before the
nova::config::end resource but up it's dependency path the
new libvirtd-tcp sources introduced in [1] depends requires
the nova::config::end anchor.

This removes the before nova::config::end on the set-secret-value
resources and only makes it depend on the get-or-set resource.

2020-06-05 08:26:58.966645 | centos-8 | (Anchor[nova::config::end] =>
Service[libvirtd-tcp] => Service[libvirt] => Exec[get-or-set virsh
secret] => Exec[set-secret-value virsh] =>
Anchor[nova::config::end])\nTry the '--graph' option and opening the
resulting '.dot' file in OmniGraffle or GraphViz

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730689/

Change-Id: Iab96968de75d7064b3aecf266d0f24b7b98dc809
(cherry picked from commit 345fac687a01075350fc057473dc042734024b04)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dependency cycle

There is a dependency cycle when using the nova::compute::libvirt
class and the nova::compute::rbd class in the same manifest.

The 'set-secret-value virsh' resource says before the
nova::config::end resource but up it's dependency path the
new libvirtd-tcp sources introduced in [1] depends requires
the nova::config::end anchor.

This removes the before nova::config::end on the set-secret-value
resources and only makes it depend on the get-or-set resource.

2020-06-05 08:26:58.966645 | centos-8 | (Anchor[nova::config::end] =>
Service[libvirtd-tcp] => Service[libvirt] => Exec[get-or-set virsh
secret] => Exec[set-secret-value virsh] =>
Anchor[nova::config::end])\nTry the '--graph' option and opening the
resulting '.dot' file in OmniGraffle or GraphViz

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730689/

Change-Id: Iab96968de75d7064b3aecf266d0f24b7b98dc809
(cherry picked from commit 345fac687a01075350fc057473dc042734024b04)

* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change-Id: Ib10098b79479aec37d7b34818dcae9deb3bc1742

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ib10098b79479aec37d7b34818dcae9deb3bc1742

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 16:06:04.000000000', 'message': 'Be explicit when passing vars into deploy steps

This continues Ia630f08f553bd53656c76e5c8059f15d314a17c0

Implicit defaults hide issues with overring ansible variables as we
pass values in from deploy-steps.j2.

Make no implicit defaults for variables passed into deploy steps via
ansible vars. Only expect those take the values defined in the caller
deploy-steps.j2 playbook template. Add missing params and vars for
templates to propagate ansible values for external deploy/upgrade,
upgrade/update and post upgrade steps playbooks.

Fix enable_paunch converted to a boolean.
Fallback to a default for python_cmd, when its fact evaluation was
skipped because of --start-at-task used.

Change-Id: I66391d9d193f6475f59544220412f7baaf7fcba5
Related-Bug: #1799914
Partial-Bug: #1749460
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Be explicit when passing vars into deploy steps

This continues Ia630f08f553bd53656c76e5c8059f15d314a17c0

Implicit defaults hide issues with overring ansible variables as we
pass values in from deploy-steps.j2.

Make no implicit defaults for variables passed into deploy steps via
ansible vars. Only expect those take the values defined in the caller
deploy-steps.j2 playbook template. Add missing params and vars for
templates to propagate ansible values for external deploy/upgrade,
upgrade/update and post upgrade steps playbooks.

Fix enable_paunch converted to a boolean.
Fallback to a default for python_cmd, when its fact evaluation was
skipped because of --start-at-task used.

Change-Id: I66391d9d193f6475f59544220412f7baaf7fcba5
Related-Bug: #1799914
Partial-Bug: #1749460
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update Ceph role's Get OSD stat to use new data structure

The variables for 'num_osds' and similar are now enclosed
in an additional map whose key is 'osdmap' so we need to
use that key when extracting them.

Change-Id: I40bed1fdc9cd39295a1b9f9aaed21d3814d7e2b5
Closes-Bug: #1882387

subject: Remove the yamlutils module.
messages:
[{'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-02-12 11:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-12 12:22:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Should be removed too:
- https://github.com/openstack/oslo.serialization/blob/master/requirements.txt#L15
- https://github.com/openstack/oslo.serialization/blob/master/lower-constraints.txt#L33

Also could be worth to put a release note related to this feature removing.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-02-12 14:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-02-12 16:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Still need that release note'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-02-13 10:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-13 10:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-02-13 10:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Does this need to be a major version bump? Have we released the new Python3-only version yet?'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-02-13 10:22:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Looks like it has.

<stephenfin> hberaud: Have we released a new py3-only package for oslo.serialization yet? https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707366/3
<stephenfin> If not, we'll want to get that patch in since it's a major version change
<hberaud> stephenfin: it was already released
<hberaud> https://gist.github.com/4383/34d67cfed23945629dd42824b8deabda
<stephenfin> okay, we need another one for that so

As such, we need to add 'Sem-Ver: api-break' to the commit message so we know that the next version should be a major version. I wonder if we need a deprecation cycle also, even if no one in OpenStack is using this yet?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-13 10:59:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

I -2ed just to avoid to get this patch included by accident in the current cycle. Please see my explainations bellow.

I agree with Stephen, it could be worth to deprecate this feature first to avoid possible issue with customer projects and API-Break, even if nobody seems to use it. it's unlikely to see someone start to use this feature now but risk exist and must be managed by semver api-break and cycle period, to inform user first and avoid to break something on the customer side.

So I propose to you to keep these changes in the current state and to add a new commit before this one to deprecate this feature first. You can do that by using debtcollector [1].

So to do that you need to decorate the class with debtcollector to inform user that this feature is now deprecated (since oslo.serialization 3.0.0) and support will be dropped in 4.0.0 and during the W cycle [2].

Don't forget to add a release note to your future commit too, with "deprecated" as topic.

Sorry for the back and forth with these changes but as explained previously if a risk exist and that we seen it then we need to address it, for the sake of stability, product quality, and clear project management.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/debtcollector/latest/user/usage.html#removing-a-class-classmethod-method-function
[2] https://releases.openstack.org/ussuri/schedule.html'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-03-03 13:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-03-11 10:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-03-27 13:33:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-04-09 10:59:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-04-20 07:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-20 13:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Now that the branch stable/ussuri was created I think we can continue with these changes, however I noticed a minor typo on the associated release note, please take a look.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-20 13:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-04-28 08:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-06-02 08:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-06-02 08:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 09:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-03 10:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Remove the yamlutils module.

The pyyaml is now safe by default:

https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/pull/74/files
https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-18342
https://github.com/search?q=oslo.serialization+yamlutils+user%3Aopenstack+language%3APython&type=Code

So the yamlutils is now useless. No project in OpenStack used this
module. We can remove it.

Sem-Ver: api-break
Change-Id: If0a98f1e15d83131cb309e02f892372f353fa5da

commit_message:
Fix for latest zeroconf version

The zeroconf library removed address in version 0.27.0 [1]
This patch should fix potential issues with that change.

[1] https://github.com/jstasiak/python-zeroconf/#changelog

Change-Id: I694ae5587ac8c3aae43d98902f56738773d31284
(cherry picked from commit 4c185438e6b07b647457068de45a73a42352f886)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 13:43:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove newline from default public_net_name

The public network name is set via public_net_name, and its default
value is the first item in the external_net_names list. The variable
uses the YAML folded block scalar notation, but does not use the
chomping indictator, which means the string is assigned a trailing
newline.

This change fixes the issue by adding the chomping indicator.

Change-Id: I68fb65cd3bc7c4390813747f9ac4ecebc3b4145f
Story: 2007654
Task: 39731
(cherry picked from commit 6beaf5b5e38c3a90651afb67899d8ee6661e2cf9)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove newline from default public_net_name

The public network name is set via public_net_name, and its default
value is the first item in the external_net_names list. The variable
uses the YAML folded block scalar notation, but does not use the
chomping indictator, which means the string is assigned a trailing
newline.

This change fixes the issue by adding the chomping indicator.

Change-Id: I68fb65cd3bc7c4390813747f9ac4ecebc3b4145f
Story: 2007654
Task: 39731
(cherry picked from commit 6beaf5b5e38c3a90651afb67899d8ee6661e2cf9)

commit_message:
Increase timeout for introspection in ironic-inspector-tempest

The job is often failing during introspection because of a timeout error,
so increasing the timeout value to prevent multiple rechecks.

Change-Id: Ide51660fc9a9848c4dfb26240cdd72cdd078273d
(cherry picked from commit 5750cca0d5b86582bd915c2b01fae5af7471ca5d)

commit_message:
Update nodejs and npm packages

This updated allow to use python3 to build grafana

Update nodejs from 8.10.0 to 10.17.0
Update npm from 3.5.4 to 6.11.3

Change-Id: I709d1e6134150f1648a8f409ce438544e15ce403
(cherry picked from commit 7c5615617fd07170a588a4c6b89bfb3961b573d1)

[{'created': '2020-05-28 19:10:11.000000000', 'message': "Increase callback timeout

One of the false positives I've observed in the last
24 hours is a job where the ramdisk did not DHCP on it's
network interfaces until the 550 second of runtime mark.

With a callback wait of 600 seconds, this means that the
deployment test job was failed moments later before the
ramdisk was fully online.

As such, lets move the timeout out a little as we're using
larger ramdisks now, and we need to allow for a longer window
at this point.

Change-Id: I26bd8f2f56732be1a75518950385caeb7b439b91
(cherry picked from commit 5f24029c40688594b7f116d3e3cf23b0b48bb446)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase callback timeout

One of the false positives I've observed in the last
24 hours is a job where the ramdisk did not DHCP on it's
network interfaces until the 550 second of runtime mark.

With a callback wait of 600 seconds, this means that the
deployment test job was failed moments later before the
ramdisk was fully online.

As such, lets move the timeout out a little as we're using
larger ramdisks now, and we need to allow for a longer window
at this point.

Change-Id: I26bd8f2f56732be1a75518950385caeb7b439b91
(cherry picked from commit 5f24029c40688594b7f116d3e3cf23b0b48bb446)

commit_message:
Centos element support specify minor version

Currently centos element only support specify release version by
DIB_RELEASE. The patch provide a named DID_MINOR_VERSION variable,
It can be used to specify the minor version of image which will be
fetchd from remote mirror.

Change-Id: Ib3f959bf15b1345d4cd0db8226ae6e781e6a9e6a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-17 16:01:40.000000000', 'message': "Adapt to new global neutron upper constraint

Neutron was added to upper constraints in openstack/requirements
stable branches (I8e95dc48b8ba2a7e16f1d34eb5ad0e87a3e96f4f), which
causes failure due to conflict with tox targets installing neutron
directly from git:

ERROR: Could not satisfy constraints for 'neutron': installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

Most of the zuul templates used in the .zuul.yaml marks neutron as
required project except lower-constraint job. Let's make that also
install neutron. Also add neutron to requirements.txt.

Note(elod.illes): by removing editable git installation of neutron from
tox and adding it to requirements.txt involves that tests in Zuul will
run against latest stable state, but locally the test will run against
latest release from stable/* of neutron. So in short: they test
different things.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to upper-constraints.txt link is
different in every stable branch.
Some other changes compared to original version:
* neutron version had to be updated to Stein in lower-constraints.txt
  and requirements.txt
* omit cap of hacking, since it was already introduced in a previous
  patch
* Change ID needed to be changed, since an earlier version of the
  original backport got merged.

(cherry picked from commit a00fc731b14bd3ef953fe4cffdc74c8e441c0e13)
(cherry picked from commit cfa217e9b1c9a346b2e7165110e4195d773268f3)

Change-Id: Id76dcad7d2c1e6810df2e84b25258c77c5d3e616
"}]
commit_message:
Adapt to new global neutron upper constraint

Neutron was added to upper constraints in openstack/requirements
stable branches (I8e95dc48b8ba2a7e16f1d34eb5ad0e87a3e96f4f), which
causes failure due to conflict with tox targets installing neutron
directly from git:

ERROR: Could not satisfy constraints for 'neutron': installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

Most of the zuul templates used in the .zuul.yaml marks neutron as
required project except lower-constraint job. Let's make that also
install neutron. Also add neutron to requirements.txt.

Note(elod.illes): by removing editable git installation of neutron from
tox and adding it to requirements.txt involves that tests in Zuul will
run against latest stable state, but locally the test will run against
latest release from stable/* of neutron. So in short: they test
different things.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to upper-constraints.txt link is
different in every stable branch.
Some other changes compared to original version:
* neutron version had to be updated to Stein in lower-constraints.txt
  and requirements.txt
* omit cap of hacking, since it was already introduced in a previous
  patch
* Change ID needed to be changed, since an earlier version of the
  original backport got merged.

(cherry picked from commit a00fc731b14bd3ef953fe4cffdc74c8e441c0e13)
(cherry picked from commit cfa217e9b1c9a346b2e7165110e4195d773268f3)

Change-Id: Id76dcad7d2c1e6810df2e84b25258c77c5d3e616

commit_message:
Remove some deprecated services

- Docker isn't supported anymore.
- Clients are now installed by Ansible, not Puppet
- Neutron SRIOV host isn't supported and operators should deploy with
  sriov_pf network object in nic configs.
- firewall is now managed by Ansible, not Puppet

Change-Id: I2b6068a719563a53bc255dcce72a92465e7df468

messages:
[{'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-06-03 14:50:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What is here is an arg added to the spec, but where is this used? It is already used inside but missing from the spec?'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:33:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> What is here is an arg added to the spec, but where is this used?
 > It is already used inside but missing from the spec?

The variable is used here [1], it's just missing in the plugin's spec which means there is no way how to control this variable when running as infrared plugin.

The new arg definition will be used when the plugin is executed using infrared - in our downstream jobs - currently we can't control the value of that variable from infrared jobs due to which we can't omit the 'Fetch console log' [1] task which generates useless console.log file containing random and incomplete data ... see RHOSINFRA-2954 bug in the Jira

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ansible-role-collect-logs/blob/fda88f8138a377abed60d77984409ffdfb1f36dd/tasks/publish.yml#L15"}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2020-06-08 06:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-06-08 08:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 19:47:58.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I5598eebe898555869cd65a74950fdbd76a7baa46

during install or test but only for docs building.

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames

[{'created': '2020-06-02 10:03:32.000000000', 'message': "Correct handling enable_venv in pip_install.yml

The way we pass it, it is a string, not a boolean. While ansible
is handling this situation for now, it's deprecated and should
not be relied on. Convert enable_venv to boolean explicitly.

Remove a redundant fact setting and redundant default() from
enable_venv (it is set in role defaults).

Also synchronize pip_install.yml to bifrost-keystone-install.

Change-Id: I35be662c4a60b4085b22d7e01b1691597f82c732
(cherry picked from commit bb807b2288551bae02dab4f34da29226b3eba5b2)
"}]
commit_message:
Correct handling enable_venv in pip_install.yml

The way we pass it, it is a string, not a boolean. While ansible
is handling this situation for now, it's deprecated and should
not be relied on. Convert enable_venv to boolean explicitly.

Remove a redundant fact setting and redundant default() from
enable_venv (it is set in role defaults).

Also synchronize pip_install.yml to bifrost-keystone-install.

Change-Id: I35be662c4a60b4085b22d7e01b1691597f82c732
(cherry picked from commit bb807b2288551bae02dab4f34da29226b3eba5b2)

commit_message:
Add glance/nova-compute to bundles

This is to resolve the associated bug where cinder-ceph has grown the
capability to block if it doesn't have an appropriate relation to
nova-compute.

Change-Id: I7c47c5d8db06ce2a206eed9f617a2eff86088a9f
Closes-Bug: #1881246

commit_message:
CentOS 8: separate kolla build tag from deploy tag

Prevously the container image tag applied to built images was configured
via 'kolla_openstack_release'. This variable also controlled the tag
used for deployed images. This could cause problems during the CentOS 8
transition, where we need to build two sets of images, and Kolla Ansible
may apply a '-centos8' suffix to the tag we specify on CentOS 8.

This change separates the tag applied to built images into a different
variable - 'kolla_tag'. The default is still 'kolla_openstack_release'.

Change-Id: I8e1d877ee91a07b86cb858d25b841f8bfcd50e21
Story: 2006574
Task: 39487

I don't think this is an issue when used with subprocess.Popen(). Only the 'paunch apply --debug' should print it quoted to be used from shell."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2020-06-08 08:29:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Below works just fine..No need for extra quoting.

import subprocess
 
program_name = 'podman'
arguments = ['ps', '-a', '--format', '{{.Names}} {{.Labels.container_name}}']
command = [program_name]
command.extend(arguments)
cmd_stdout, cmd_stderr = subprocess.Popen(command, stdout=subprocess.PIPE).communicate()
print(cmd_stdout)"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-06-08 09:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Properly quote the contnainers' formatters

Fix the unquoted formatter (fails):
Error: `podman ps` takes no arguments

to become the quoted one (works):
Up About a minute ago hardcore_borg

This works the same way for podman and docker.

Change-Id: I6db7afed6e58c52231fea53ba753663717d880b7
Closes-Bug: #1881229
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Silence huge human-unreadable logs

Ansible tasks that invoke puppet produce excessive and barealy readable
outputs. The established pattern is to silence it and only provide a
pretty-formatted debug if the former has failed.

Also align the puppet invocation for the same configuration of
iptables pattern in I7174d687e0cf2304f7d4deab68ca392dd750c74c

Change-Id: I57038a6185a1f533b2e51257b75ed448f036514e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:22:24.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I17c818e0e2cb5b4dc2b24cf689ceeb9b391c83bf
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I17c818e0e2cb5b4dc2b24cf689ceeb9b391c83bf

[{'created': '2020-06-03 20:15:26.000000000', 'message': "Constrain oslo.log to be less than version 4.1.2

Versions of oslo.log >= 4.1.2 require a second argument when
initializing the OSJournalHandler class. While I've started
a review to fix that regression [0], constrain oslo.log to an
earlier version that does not require this new flag to fix
the gate.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/732457

Related-bug: #1871840

commit_message:
Constrain oslo.log to be less than version 4.1.2

Versions of oslo.log >= 4.1.2 require a second argument when
initializing the OSJournalHandler class. While I've started
a review to fix that regression [0], constrain oslo.log to an
earlier version that does not require this new flag to fix
the gate.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/732457

Change-Id: I845d5d8e588c182a0095791f4fc37818679369ba
Related-bug: #1871840

commit_message:
CI: Fix Ironic and Zun scenarios testing

Originally Stein only but later the bug was introduced in older
branches as well.

In [1] a small regression has been introduced, which permanently
disabled installation of extra clients (Ironic, Zun) because
of SCENARIO (Train+ CI) replacing ACTION.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/717259

Change-Id: I1f28f1ddb78d1909ff810111766eff173d47f7ce
Closes-Bug: #1872481
(cherry picked from commit 06db02b4b0e20c0587305c6fd448c70d68019386)

commit_message:
Pin zeroconf to 0.26.3

The latest release of zeroconf (0.27) have Backwards incompatible changes [1],
and it breaks ironic-lib, since zeroconf is onlyl used by ironic projects
it should be ok to pin to 0.26.3.

[1] https://github.com/jstasiak/python-zeroconf/#changelog

Change-Id: I775bb306628d1c49661cf7ab53f66b524e20b72f

commit_message:
Incoming tenant id when creating a subnet on create network form

On admin panel, when creating a network and creating a subnet,
the tenant to which the network belongs and the tenant to which
the subnet belongs are inconsistent.
This patch uniform network and subnet tenant ID

Change-Id: I3744d8b7a0a37918962c9d9a2ac319002de93851
Closes-Bug: #1823627

[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:49:22.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]

- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238

Change-Id: Ifeaa5ba961c849a40407f4b3cc172f1423df3eaf
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ifeaa5ba961c849a40407f4b3cc172f1423df3eaf

subject: CI: Fix Ironic and Zun scenarios testing
messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-08 07:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-08 07:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-08 07:24:56.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Fix Ironic and Zun scenarios testing

Originally Stein only but later the bug was introduced in older
branches as well.

In [1] a small regression has been introduced, which permanently
disabled installation of extra clients (Ironic, Zun) because
of SCENARIO (Train+ CI) replacing ACTION.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/717259

Change-Id: I1f28f1ddb78d1909ff810111766eff173d47f7ce
Closes-Bug: #1872481
(cherry picked from commit 06db02b4b0e20c0587305c6fd448c70d68019386)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Fix Ironic and Zun scenarios testing

Originally Stein only but later the bug was introduced in older
branches as well.

In [1] a small regression has been introduced, which permanently
disabled installation of extra clients (Ironic, Zun) because
of SCENARIO (Train+ CI) replacing ACTION.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/717259

Change-Id: I1f28f1ddb78d1909ff810111766eff173d47f7ce
Closes-Bug: #1872481
(cherry picked from commit 06db02b4b0e20c0587305c6fd448c70d68019386)

commit_message:
Don't check if any bridges were recrected when OVS was restarted

In case when openvswitch was restarted, full sync of all bridges will
be always triggered by neutron-ovs-agent so there is no need to check
in same rpc_loop iteration if bridges were recreated.

Change-Id: I3cc1f1b7dc480d54a7cee369e4638f9fd597c759
Related-bug: #1864822
