commit_message:
tcib/ceilometer-base: remove panko dependency

Aodh was deprecated, panko isn't needed anymore for ceilometer images.
We already didn't ship it on OSP, let's align with the upstream image.

Change-Id: I5f08cd74b19362611c76ecf31befd3b7eaf5a010

subject: Remove obsolete 'http' backend from glance configuration
messages:
[{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-06-05 16:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-06-05 19:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-06-05 19:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If you deploy Distributed Multibackend Storage and don't have this patch, then a web import with --all-stores True hit a os_glance_failed_import for a store called "http". Though Glance added a filter so that http is excluded, we still shouldn't set it up. Maybe we should open a bug so that this tripleo patch can be backported?

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/features/distributed_multibackend_storage.html

[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1881958'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-06-05 20:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 16:27:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove obsolete 'http' backend from glance configuration

Glance has a read-only 'http' backend that is obsolete now that tripleo
supports glance multi-store (multiple backends). Glance's web-download
import method no longer relies on the 'http' backend, so tripleo should
no longer include 'http' in the list of enabled backends.

Change-Id: I64ee3a3c8f0dabdeab16968c39ea00b8879f5405
"}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete 'http' backend from glance configuration

Glance has a read-only 'http' backend that is obsolete now that tripleo
supports glance multi-store (multiple backends). Glance's web-download
import method no longer relies on the 'http' backend, so tripleo should
no longer include 'http' in the list of enabled backends.

Change-Id: I64ee3a3c8f0dabdeab16968c39ea00b8879f5405

commit_message:
s3api: Check whether versioning is enabled more

Previously, attempting to GET, HEAD, or DELETE an object with a non-null
version-id would cause 500s, with logs complaining about how

    version-aware operations require that the container is versioned

Now, we'll early-return with a 404 (on GET or HEAD) or 204 (on DELETE).

Change-Id: I46bfd4ae7d49657a94734962c087f350e758fead
Closes-Bug: 1874295

soon; good catch."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-18 00:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-30 05:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-06-03 05:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-06-03 05:33:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

This is awesome. Running and watching all the SR PUTs on a `swift-init container-sharder once` is really off putting when you see how many requests its making.

Then run again with this patch, and wow, _much_ nicer. It's an awesome cleanup.

And because every time a sharder checks a shard it updates the meta_timestamp we can't really get latched to a bad shard update because if the object/byte count is different it'll still send.

I guess that could mean we could keep getting requests being sent if/until containers agree on counts. But this is much better then _always_ sending PUT requests when nothing has changed!"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-05 22:29:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

this is getting the job done functionally, tim's addressed some concerns, the code and tests all seems in order

Matt's comments helped me a lot; I'm at least partially approving based on his sign-off and my earlier review - I think this works and it seems reasonable."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-06 01:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Latch shard-stat reporting

The idea is, if none of

  - timestamp,
  - object_count,
  - bytes_used,
  - state, or
  - epoch

has changed, we shouldn't need to send an update back to the root
container.

This is more-or-less comparable to what the container-updater does to
avoid unnecessary writes to the account.

Closes-Bug: #1834097
Change-Id: I1ee7ba5eae3c508064714c4deb4f7c6bbbfa32af

subject: Don't auto-create shard containers
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-29 05:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-05-29 06:17:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, cool I think this makes sense in my head :)

Just building up some new SAIOs for next week. When that's done I'll give it a whirl and test it out a bit.

Then I'll come back and give it a score (hopefully a +2) ;)"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-05-29 06:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-29 20:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-05-29 22:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-01 23:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(4 comments)

so with unsharded dbs this happens all the time, you do a rebalance - then someone does an upload preceeded by a container put and followed by a container listing - voila stale listing

I think we could be a bit more conservative about listings in the proxy - look at put-timestamp or something and make another request

... but for re-balancing *sharded* dbs this works *surprisingly* well

 * you can do a pre-flight PUT or not, root db is already on disk
 * you can have out-of-date stats or not depending which shard updates the root (should shards on handoffs skip updates?)
 * async pending storage seems to work until replicator creates db
 * since listings go directly to the still online shards you get accurate listings even if the stats aren't up-to-date

We probably thought about this when working through sharding rebalance; and decided "it'd be no worse than a client doing a PUT before an upload" - maybe that wasn't good enough

I guess clients using unsharded dbs may have learned if they don't like new/empty listings they can avoid the pre-flight container create PUT - but shards in effect take away the choice by using the autocreate namespace.  So maybe this is just bringing shard db's more inline with best practices.

I don't think the system dot-account namespace necessarily HAD to be synonymous with "auto create" and I suppose it's moving away from that; but I guess this bug isn't the time to rework all of that.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-06-02 07:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Looks good still, but I wonder if we need a test that proves a requests with X-Record-Type: Shard will return a 201. Just for completeness. 

Maybe something like: http://paste.openstack.org/show/794225/'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-02 21:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe useful addition? http://paste.openstack.org/show/794261/'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-03 00:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-06-03 00:30:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

We could stop adding if not shardranges send, that kinda makes sense, why go create a broker db if don't have a shard to put in. Not sure when this would ever happen though. But obviously the test shows it's possible.

But happy with leave it as it is."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-03 14:36:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The more we're trying to "tweak" the shard range PUT behavior the less confident I am in the content of this patch.  But I'm sure it's just because I don't grok the requirements on this method from the sharder.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-03 17:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-03 17:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(5 comments)

I'm on board with this - thank you tim"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-03 18:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-03 19:04:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-03 19:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

I don't think https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733343/ is required to merge this change; or see any necessary reason to argue it be squashed.

this works for me."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-03 19:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-03 20:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2020-06-05 00:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-29 05:34:29.000000000', 'message': "Don't auto-create shard containers based on object updates

Previously, you could get real jittery listings during a rebalance:

 * Partition with a shard DB get reassigned, so one primary has no DB.
 * Proxy makes a listing, gets a 404, tries another node. Likely, one of
   the other shard replicas responds. Things are fine.
 * Update comes in. Since we use the auto_create_account_prefix
   namespace for shards, container DB gets created and we write the row.
 * Proxy makes another listing. There's a one-in-three chance that we
   claim there's only one object in that whole range.

Note that unsharded databases would respond to the update with a 404 and
wait for one of the other primaries (or the old primary that's now a
hand-off) to rsync a whole DB over, keeping us in the happy state.

Now, if the account is in the shards namespace, 404 the object update if
we have no DB. Wait for replication like in the unsharded case.

Continue to be willing to create the DB based on a shard-range update,
though; we need that when first creating the shard containers before
cleaving.

Change-Id: I15052f3f17999e6f432951ba7c0731dcdc9475bb
Closes-Bug: #1881210
"}, {'created': '2020-06-03 00:09:34.000000000', 'message': "Don't auto-create shard containers based on object updates

Previously, you could get real jittery listings during a rebalance:

 * Partition with a shard DB get reassigned, so one primary has no DB.
 * Proxy makes a listing, gets a 404, tries another node. Likely, one of
   the other shard replicas responds. Things are fine.
 * Update comes in. Since we use the auto_create_account_prefix
   namespace for shards, container DB gets created and we write the row.
 * Proxy makes another listing. There's a one-in-three chance that we
   claim there's only one object in that whole range.

Note that unsharded databases would respond to the update with a 404 and
wait for one of the other primaries (or the old primary that's now a
hand-off) to rsync a whole DB over, keeping us in the happy state.

Now, if the account is in the shards namespace, 404 the object update if
we have no DB. Wait for replication like in the unsharded case.

Continue to be willing to create the DB based on a shard-range update,
though; we need that when first creating the shard containers before
cleaving.

Change-Id: I15052f3f17999e6f432951ba7c0731dcdc9475bb
Closes-Bug: #1881210

commit_message:
Don't auto-create shard containers

...unless the client requests it specifically using a new flag:

   X-Backend-Auto-Create: true

Previously, you could get real jittery listings during a rebalance:

 * Partition with a shard DB get reassigned, so one primary has no DB.
 * Proxy makes a listing, gets a 404, tries another node. Likely, one of
   the other shard replicas responds. Things are fine.
 * Update comes in. Since we use the auto_create_account_prefix
   namespace for shards, container DB gets created and we write the row.
 * Proxy makes another listing. There's a one-in-three chance that we
   claim there's only one object in that whole range.

Note that unsharded databases would respond to the update with a 404 and
wait for one of the other primaries (or the old primary that's now a
hand-off) to rsync a whole DB over, keeping us in the happy state.

Now, if the account is in the shards namespace, 404 the object update if
we have no DB. Wait for replication like in the unsharded case.

Continue to be willing to create the DB when the sharder is seeding all
the CREATED databases before it starts cleaving, though.

Change-Id: I15052f3f17999e6f432951ba7c0731dcdc9475bb
Closes-Bug: #1881210

commit_message:
tests: Bump up timeout for unit and in-process func tests

We've been seeing more TIMEOUT failures lately where the jobs still seem
to be making steady (if slow) progress.

Change-Id: I19c1f48bace551c78ad0c6c8b6ccad75e44e8904

commit_message:
[fs038] Update tempest config for octavia

It adds following tempest config:
* region
* enabled_provider_drivers

It is needed for running ironic tests for fs038,
the job will be triggered in periodic pipeline for
stein, rocky and queens [1.]

[1.] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/27587/

Change-Id: Ie5534b4da9f4155bca2cd8023909bb5d3893a24c
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-19 06:00:43.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change-Id: I4af25bbc8d990aa5e70ee63ba7477d2964872b3f
'}, {'created': '2020-05-21 07:30:45.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4af25bbc8d990aa5e70ee63ba7477d2964872b3f

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I4af25bbc8d990aa5e70ee63ba7477d2964872b3f

Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I9cad8904420d108a06d9fefbc2d3268738d56038

commit_message:
Fix nova-virtlogd container healthcheck

As of now, nova-virtlogd container healthcheck is failing
after deployment.

This change fixes the nova-virtlogd container healthcheck
by checking /run/libvirt/virtlogd-sock socket instead
of /var/run/libvirt/virtlogd-sock socket.

Change-Id: I1eee0cf34be9bf26fee0e4db832f8d141fee449b
(cherry picked from commit f694274410015a2e7df7c74db7d327cca259b2bb)
(cherry picked from commit 2f23164b7f93e92d3979e6b020204be5559095ec)

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I0adf159968af36cb844300727a8f3ece9a54d78a
